caption:
This photograph captures a scene involving several individuals and a car with its hood open. The car, predominantly white, features the logo of the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) on its side. It is a classic sedan, likely from the 1970s based on its design, paired with solid and simple rims.

In the foreground, a man, balding with dark and grey hair, dressed in a striped suit, is bending slightly over to examine the engine of the car. His expression indicates a focus on the task at hand. 

Behind him, there are additional men wearing business attire. One man appears to be in mid-conversation, possibly addressing someone not visible in the frame. These men are dressed in suits and ties - typical professional or government official attire.

The environment suggests this event could be outside a business or government building. The building visible in the background has a modern design with elements like large windows and partial brickwork, possibly indicating office or institutional use.

Overall, the mood seems semi-formal with a focus on the task with the car, possibly relating to an inspection, demonstration, or similar official event organized by or involving the EPA.
title: Exhibit at the first symposium on low pollution power systems development held at the marriott motor inn, ann arbor vehicles and hardware were assembled at the epa ann arbor laboratory.  Part of the exhibit was held in the motel parking lot shown here is the epa/williams gas turbine car
